Name: Power-operated and power-assisted doors.
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to power-operated and power-assisted doors

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings

Summary: This bill would require that certain types of new or renovated buildings have at least one power-operated or power-assisted door at an entrance and exit. It would also require signs that direct people to the power-operated or power-assisted door.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1. Section BC 1109 of the New York city building code is amended by adding a new section 1109.18 to read as follows:
1109.18 Power-operated doors. At least one door at an accessible entrance and egress to any Assembly Group A, Business Group B, Education Group E, Institutional Group I-1, I-2 or I-3, Mercantile Group M, Residential Group R-1 or Group R-2 occupancy shall be a power-operated or power-assisted and low-energy door that complies with Section 1010.1.4.2.

      � 2. Section 1111.2 of the New York city building code is amended by adding a new item 6 to read as follows:
6. At each entrance or egress to a building required to have a power-operated or power-assisted and low-energy door in accordance with Section 1109.18, the nearest such power-operated door.
      � 3. This local law takes effect January 1, 2023.
